SDG_TARGET:
15.8

By 2020, introduce measures to prevent the introduction and significantly reduce the impact of invasive alien species on land and water ecosystems and control or eradicate the priority species
SDG_INDICATOR:
15.8.1

Proportion of countries adopting relevant national legislation and adequately resourcing the prevention or control of invasive alien species
STAT_CONC_DEF:
This indicator aims to quantify trends in:

Part A: Commitment by countries to relevant multinational agreements, specifically:

(1) National adoption of invasive alien species-relevant international policy.

(2) Percentage of countries with

(a) national strategies for preventing and controlling invasive alien species; and (b) national legislation and policy relevant to invasive alien species.

Part B: The translation of policy arrangements into action by countries to implement policy and actively prevent and control invasive alien species IAS and the resourcing of this action, specifically:

(3) National allocation of resources towards the prevention or control of invasive alien species.
COMPARABILITY:
Indicator available

Rwanda Biodiversity Policy (2011)

The Biodiversity Policy clearly states that the unregulated entry, introduction and spread of alien organisms can have adverse impacts on biodiversity and ecosystems. Through this Policy, Government establishes a legal framework for controlling and regulating the introduction and spread of such organisms in Rwanda.
